findings.title: PAV - Pair Address Validation
findings.description: The contract is missing address validation in the pair address argument, which can introduce security risks and potential attacks.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the price of the token can be highly volatile, potentially leading to significant price volatility for parties involved.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of certain variables without checking if their current state is equal to the one given as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract by calling the `recoverStuckTokens` function, leading to an inconsistency between the contract's balance and variables `tokensForMarketing`, `tokensForExpenses`, `tokensForManagement`, and `tokensForDeveloper`.

findings.title: ULTW - Transfers Liquidity to Team Wallet
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer funds without limit to the team wallet. These funds have been accumulated from fees collected from the contract.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards, but does not use the `immutable` declaration which can save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, which can improve readability and maintainability. The finding highlights non-conformance to these naming conventions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.
